description: Little Red Riding Hood is the retelling of the classic fairy tale in which Red, a clever and brave girl, is tricked by a sly wolf. With her quick wit, Red manages to save herself and her grandmother from becoming Wolf's dinner. The book can also be used to teach students how to make, revise, and confirm predictions and to identify cause-and-effect relationships. The book and lesson are also available for levels L and O.
